{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\cocoartf1038\cocoasubrtf360 {\fonttbl\f0\fswiss\fcharset0 Helvetica;} {\colortbl;\red255\green255\blue255;\red109\green140\blue64;} \pard\tx560\tx1120\tx1680\tx2240\tx2800\tx3360\tx3920\tx4480\tx5040\tx5600\tx6160\tx6720\ql\qnatural\pardirnatural
\f0\b\fs20 \cf0 \ \ \ Enabling Distributed Applications \ \pard\tx560\tx1120\tx1680\tx2240\tx2800\tx3360\tx3920\tx4480\tx5040\tx5600\tx6160\tx6720\ql\qnatural\pardirnatural
\b0\fs14 \cf0 \ \pard\tx560\tx1120\tx1680\tx2240\tx2800\tx3360\tx3920\tx4480\tx5040\tx5600\tx6160\tx6720\ql\qnatural\pardirnatural
\fs20 \cf0 Pilot-API has been used to support a wide range of infrastructures, applications types and usage modes [fig. r.]. The developers of Pilot-API, SAGA team is actively involved in significant future research and developments like: \fs14 \
\fs20 \b \cf2 o \b0 \cf0 A Pilot abstraction to support treatment of data and compute equally called Pilot-Data; i.e., to manage and schedule data along with compute units -- an important requirement for distributed data-intensive applications.\
\b \cf2 o \b0 \cf0 A distributed Pilot-MapReduce framework using Pilot Abstractions which can opportunistically exploit multiple resources of heterogenous resources concurrently.}

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\cocoartf1038\cocoasubrtf360 {\fonttbl\f0\fswiss\fcharset0 Helvetica;} {\colortbl;\red255\green255\blue255;} \pard\tx560\tx1120\tx1680\tx2240\tx2800\tx3360\tx3920\tx4480\tx5040\tx5600\tx6160\tx6720\qj\pardirnatural
\f0\b\fs20 \cf0 P* Model of Pilot Abstractions: \b0 The P* Model is derived from an analysis of many PJ implementations; based upon this analysis, the common elements of the P* Model are:\ \pard\tx560\tx1120\tx1680\tx2240\tx2800\tx3360\tx3920\tx4480\tx5040\tx5600\tx6160\tx6720\qj\pardirnatural
\i\b \cf0 \ Pilot \i0 : \b0 The pilot is the entity that actually gets submitted and scheduled on a resource. The PJ provides application (user) level control and management of the set of allocated resources.\
\i\b \ Compute Unit (CU) \i0\b0 : A CU encapsulates a self-contained piece of work ( a task) specified by the application that is submitted to the Pilot-Job framework. There is no intrinsic notion of resource associated with a CU.\
\i\b \ Scheduling Unit (SU): \i0\b0 SUs are the units of scheduling internal to the P* Model, i.e., it is not known by or visible to an application. Once a CU is under the control of the Pilot-Job framework, it is assigned to an SU.\
\i\b \ Pilot-Manager (PM): \i0\b0 The PM is responsible for (i) orchestrating the interaction between the Pilots as well as the different components of the P* Model (CUs, SUs) and (ii) decisions related to internal resource assignment (once resources have been acquired by the Pilot-Job). For example, an SU can consists of one or more CUs. The PM determines how to group them and when SUs are scheduled and executed on a resource via the Pilot.\ \ \pard\tx560\tx1120\tx1680\tx2240\tx2800\tx3360\tx3920\tx4480\tx5040\tx5600\tx6160\tx6720\qj\pardirnatural
\b \cf0 \ \
\b0 \ }
